edu.illinois.cs.cs125.spring2019.mp3.lib

Class RecognizePhoto

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.cs.cs125.spring2019.mp3.lib.RecognizePhoto

  • public final class RecognizePhoto
extends java.lang.Object
    Image recognition class. Each function takes the JSON returned by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API and extracts some piece of information from it.

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth(java.lang.String json)
        Get the image width.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON string returned by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API
        Returns:
        the width of the image or 0 on failure

      • getHeight

        public static int getHeight(java.lang.String json)
        Get the image height.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON string returned by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API
        Returns:
        the height of the image or 0 on failure

      • getFormat

        public static java.lang.String getFormat(java.lang.String json)
        Get the image file type.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON string returned by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API
        Returns:
        the type of the image or null

      • getCaption

        public static java.lang.String getCaption(java.lang.String json)
        Return the caption describing the image created by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API. If multiple captions are provided your code should return the first one.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON string returned by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API
        Returns:
        the caption describing the image created by the Microsoft or null on failure

      • isADog

        public static boolean isADog(java.lang.String json,
                             double minConfidence)
        Determine whether the image contains a dog. You should do this by examining the tags returned by the Cognitive Services API. If a tag with the name "dog" exists with at least the provided confidence, you should return true. Otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON string returned by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API
        minConfidence - the minimum confidence required for this determination
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the image contains a dog or false on failure

      • isACat

        public static boolean isACat(java.lang.String json,
                             double minConfidence)
        Determine whether the image contains a cat. You should do this by examining the tags returned by the Cognitive Services API. If a tag with the name "cat" exists with at least the provided confidence, you should return true. Otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON string returned by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API
        minConfidence - the minimum confidence required for this determination
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the image contains a cat or false on failure

      • isRick

        public static boolean isRick(java.lang.String json)
        Check if image contains Rick Astley. We leave it to you to determine how to do this by examining the JSON returned for various images. Note that you do not need to consider the confidence value to complete this function.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSON returned by the Microsoft Cognitive Services API
        Returns:
        true if you've Rickrolled yourself
        See Also:
        Rickrolling
